alert.note: Alert for Butler; Elk; Greenwood; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 2:55AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Elk, Wilson, Butler, Woodson and Greenwood Counties through 400 AM CDT... At 254 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Hamilton to 5 miles northeast of Leon. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... El Dorado, Augusta, Eureka, Fredonia, Yates Center, Leon, Altoona, Toronto, Hamilton, Severy, Buffalo, Fall River, Neosho Falls, Latham, Rosalia, Benedict, Climax, Virgil, New Albany and Coyville. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 65 and 90. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
